intro: Geissois montana var. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent mountain geissois, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often bright flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, pubescent leaves and stems, which give it its varietal name. It typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and often display shades of pink or white, making it an ornamental plant in horticulture.
